title.narrative: Fruit processing and marketing for economic inclusion of youth and women in Northern Armenia and Southern Georgia

description.narrative: The project builds capacities among small-scale fruit growers and gets them to benefit, e.g. via cooperative schemes and other ownership models, from value addition via quality production as well as sorting, storage, processing and marketing of their products. The project will build on existing fruit production potential, investment opportunities in a yet to-be-developed local fruit processing sector and opportunities for marketing of quality fruit products. It will also benefit from synergies with existing UNIDO engagement in Armenia including the EU and Austrian Development Agency Funded European Neighbourhood Programme for Agriculture and Rural Development (ENPARD) and the Austrian funded project on Productive Work for Youth as well as other projects of development partners t. Synergies are also expected from to-be-developed business partnerships between Armenian processors and private buyers in Europe such as Adolf Darbo Aktiengesellschaft, AGRANA J&F Holding GmbH, and Lucas Bols Amsterdam B.V all which indicated interest in sourcing fruit pulp from Armenia. The project’s goal is to improve the quality of life of rural populations in Northern Armenia. The expected outcomes of the project are that a) farm households, especially women-managed, professionalize their businesses and gain improved income from fruit production and b) value addition capacities are created that provide associated farmers, especially young women and men, with income and employment. The target population constitute about 3.000 farm households. They benefit indirectly from the better marketing conditions for fruits that the project will create. 500 famers will benefit directly from selling their products to the processing plant and from training on improved farm management, diversification and the production and handling of quality fruits.
